intro: Argemone mexicana var. spinosa, commonly known as the Mexican prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain oil-rich seeds, which have been used traditionally for various purposes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its adaptability, it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
